p: Essential oil from the oleo-gum-resin of the methoxydecane frankincense was obtained by hydrodistillation in amounts ranging from 2.68% to 5.45%. All samples were dominated by decyl methyl ether (26.6–47.9%), with smaller amounts of octyl methyl ether (3.6–9.2%) ( Table 1). Serratol was also prominent in most samples (2.7–31.8%). Other components included sabinene, incensole, germacrene D, verticilla-4(20),7,11-triene, and an unidentified sesquiterpene alcohol ( Table 1).
